One source familiar with the effort to recruit Mike Pence tells National Review Online that while Mike Pence could have united the conservative movement, his departure leaves a Republican field that "is never going to be as wide-open again."----------------------

who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside. " Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, " Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. " Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaken by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his "adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, among other things to expand Google's reach around the world. Eric Schmidt will also continue to act as an advisor to Page and Sergey Brin .
